snippet: Tokyo will start over in designing the centerpiece of the 2020 Games, which, if built, would probably have been the costliest sports venue in history.
abstract: Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe says government has scrapped plans for stadium that would have cost more than $2 billion and would have served as centerpiece venue of 2020 Olympic Games; stadium, which was designed by Zaha Hadid, stadium became center of controversy immediately after Tokyo was selected to host games; Abe says stadium's design will be completely redone.
lead_paragraph: Tokyo will start over in designing the centerpiece of the 2020 Games, which, if built, would probably have been the costliest sports venue in history.

headline.main: Japan Scraps Olympic Stadium Plan Over $2 Billion Price Tag
headline.print_headline: Japan Scraps Stadium Plan for Olympics Over the Cost
